name: Loch Funzie, Da Snap and Aith

ai.summary: A scenic 8.8 km moderate hike around Loch Funzie, Da Snap and Aith in the UK. The route features lochside paths, grassy tracks and short stretches of uneven ground, offering a mix of open views and sheltered sections.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly firm lochside paths and grassy tracks with occasional rocky or muddy patches. Expect uneven ground, short ascents and descents, and potential boggy sections after rain. Weather can change quickly; waterproof footwear and layered clothing are advised. Some sections may include boardwalk-style paths.
ai.safety_notes: - Check weather and daylight hours before you go; UK conditions can change rapidly. - The route traverses rural ground with limited mobile reception; carry a map, compass or offline GPS. - Bring enough water and snacks, and inform someone of your plans. - Wear sturdy footwear and dress in layers; be prepared for mud, wind, and rain. - Respect property boundaries and gates; close gates behind you.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots or shoes with good grip
Water bottle or hydration system (2–3 liters as needed)
Layered, weather-appropriate clothing with a waterproof jacket
Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly April–October) generally offer the best weather and daylight for this hike. The route can be tackled year-round with appropriate gear and planning.

seo.title: Loch Funzie, Da Snap and Aith – 8.8 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Loch Funzie, Da Snap and Aith 8.8 km moderate hike in the UK. Lochside paths, varied terrain and open views. Plan for 2–3 hours and include proper gear.
seo.h1: Loch Funzie, Da Snap and Aith – 8.8 km Moderate Hike in the UK
